name: Popular Tea Cakes Workshop
description: Popular Tea Cakes Workshops We cover a variety of  of 5 various tea cakes that we teach from scratch. We use only the best of ingredients and source everything locally. We teach you how to bake cakes and the frostings that go with it, in a tradiotional method. Its a hands on experince and we provide the students with hand outs which they will be taking home with them.-Banana Cake with Dark Chocolate Chips-Sticky Toffee Date Cake with Salted Caramel Sauce -Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting -Orange Pound Cake Looking forward to baking the world a better place!

name: Eggless Cake Making Workshop
description: Weclome to our Eggless Cake Making Workshop!We teach you to bake your cakes to perfection with giving you a product thats so flavourful, you don't feel the absence of egg at all.What will you learn?-Eggless Vanilla Sponge -Eggless Chocolate Sponge -Couverture Chocolate Ganache -Salted Caramel -Whipping of Organic fresh cream (sourced from France) -Flavour Pairings (Caramel Chocolate Cake, Black Forest Cake, Classic Chocolate Cake , Fresh Cream Fruit Cake ).We make sure you embrace the art of baking and use the skills you will learn to best use.

name: Cupcake Workshop
description: This Cupcake workshop is a great introduction to the world of baking! The little cakes have techniques and tricks to the process which we gladly would share to better your baking experince. We cover a variety of topics during this class.The list goes as follows-Vanilla Cupcake Chocolate Cupcake Red Velvet Cupcake Chocolate Chip Muffin Vanilla Buttercream Frosting Chocolate Frosting Cream Cheese Frosting A hands on, interactive and informative session that you will Love!

name: Cheesecake Workshop
description: This class is for all the cheescake lovers. Here at Flourish, we teach you a variety of cheesecakes that range with technique and flavour. Tips, tricks and methods pertaining to perfecting your cheesecake is covered in this class. A variety of 3 cheesecakes is taught.-Baked New York Cheesecake -Frozen Fruit Cheesecake -Cotton Cheesecake (Japanese Cheesecake) All information regarding the baking of these widely different cheesecake will be passed on to our students. We provide you with all the ingredients, tools and know-how for the class including a handout which you will be taking home. Along with that, you will be taking the lovely cheesecakes you've made at the class, back home to your friends and family. Join us for a fun filled, cheese-centric workshop! Cheers!

name: Brownie Workshop
description: Join us in  baking two versions of a delectable Brownie. Everything we teach you is made from scartch. Tips, tricks and techniques required to perfecting your brownie is thoroughly taught at this class. Various ways to spice up your brownie with toppings and what combination works best! You will learn-An Eggless Brownie A Brownie with Egg Both versions of the brownie is fanatstic and you can't chose which one you like more!All ingredients are provided to you including the tools! We provide you with handouts as well which you will be taking home with you along with the brownies youve made yourself! Looking forward to a delectable class filled with chocolate and fun!

name: The Courtyard Baithak | Sitar Soirée with Sahana Banerjee
description: Sitar Soirée with Sahana Banerjee | An Evening of Hindustani Classical Instrumental RecitalAbout Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the Artist - Sahana BanerjeeMeet Sahana Banerjee, a talented sitarist with a rich musical heritage! Recognized as a child prodigy, Sahana hails from the esteemed Rampur Senia Gharana, a lineage that traces back to the legendary Mian Tansen. Her journey began at just four years old, playing the sitar under the guidance of her father, Pandit Santhosh Banerjee, a renowned maestro himself.Sahana's music blends traditional Indian classical styles with her own unique flair, creating a captivating sound that's both soulful and dynamic. She’s passionate about sharing her knowledge, conducting both online and in-person classes for students around the world, including from India, Germany, France, and beyond.Not just a performer, Sahana also actively engages in workshops and lecture-demonstrations, helping her students develop their skills and connect with the music on a deeper level. She's performed at various music festivals and even collaborated with international artists, bringing Indian classical music to new audiences.With numerous accolades under her belt, including the Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Award, Sahana is a true ambassador of Indian music. Whether she’s performing on stage or teaching her students, her passion for music shines through in everything she does.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: 'The Truman Show' (1998) Movie Screening | Family Movie Night
description: Family Movie Night at The Studio, Courtyard, ShantinagarJoin us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this film while cozying up with your family!Given the nature of the film, we recommend it for children aged 7 and older.About the movie:This month, we’re screening The Truman Show, a clever and heartwarming film that follows Truman Burbank, a man who unknowingly lives his entire life on a reality TV show. As Truman begins to question the world around him, he sets off on a journey to discover the truth and take control of his own life. With its mix of humor, adventure, and life lessons, this film invites kids to think about curiosity, self-discovery, and the power of choice, all while keeping everyone entertained.Why Attend?Broaden Horizons with Global Tales: Dive into diverse artistic expressions through rare masterpieces curated for children.Quality Family Bonding: Embark on a cinematic journey to a new country each month, forging lasting memories and strengthening family connections.Uncover Hidden Treasures: Discover lesser-known gems handpicked for their artistic brilliance and captivating storytelling.Artistic Excellence: Immerse your child in films of unparalleled artistic merit, fueling their imagination and creativity.Safe Family Environment: Enjoy movies in a secure, family-friendly setting, ensuring a worry-free experience for kids and parents alike.Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema.Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.The Event is taking place at Courtyard's indoor Studio space on the second floor.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.

name: The Courtyard Picnic with ROMA Italian Deli | October Edition
description: About October PicnicJoin us under the canopy of our lush city oasis for a sun-soaked (fingers crossed!) afternoon filled with board games, wine, coffee, and irresistible picnic plates by ROMA Italian Deli On the menu  Classic Arancini (360)Creamy mozzarella cheese encased in al dente risotto rice, coated in breadcrumbs and fried to perfection. Truffle Mushroom Panini (350)Sautéed button and wild mushrooms, truffle mushroom spread and crispy hash browns, topped with fresh rocket and romaine.Chorizo Panini (410)Spicy sausage chorizo ragout, pickled onion, crispy hash-browns, balsamic caramelised onion, fresh rocket and romaineMama Milano (675)Classic Salami milano paired with creamy mayo, crisp lettuce, ripe tomato and fresh mozzarellaThe Da Vinci (450)Crispy breaded chicken, pesto rosso, broiled mozzarella, parmesan shavings and dressed rocketTiramisu (400)The perfect "pick me up," our tiramisu is an Italian classic with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers, whipped eggs, mascarpone cheese, and a dusting of cocoa._________And don’t forget—your furry friends are welcome to join the fun too!See you at the yard for a perfect day out with great food, great coffee, and even better company. Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Bringing outside food into the yard area is not permitted.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain or other unforeseen conditions, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Food Nerd Festival - Immersives 2024 - Bangalore: All Day Pass
description: Food Nerd Festival is a celebration of all things food! So this festival is for anyone who’s obsessed with food! Whether you're a chef, foodie, flavour geek, or love to nerd out over the latest culinary trends and techniques, the Food Nerd Festival is your jam.With 4 workshops centred around the basic cooking elements, these immersives will leave you with an elevated culinary game.Salt by Chef Gautam & Bala (@gonzogarbanzo & @saltycuredpigs) (11-12:30)Guided Overview & History Of Preservation TechniquesExploring Techniques Of Pickling & Preserving In India & Around The WorldUnderstanding Curing Salts & The Science Behind ThemExpert Tips On Mastering Salt, Time, & FermentationLive Demonstration Of A Traditional Pickling TechniqueLive Demonstration Of A Meat Curing TechniqueRecipes For Pickling & Curing Bacon At HomeFat by Heena Punwani (@tiffintales, founder of Maska Bakery) (1:00-2:30)Cracking The Code Of Baking Theory: The Science Behind ItThe History Of Fats In CookingUnderstanding Different Fats In Indian BakingCookie Tasting Session Showcasing Different FatsOil Vs. Ghee: Flavor ShowdownLive Fat-Washing Cocktail DemoAcid by Payal Shah (@kobofermentery) (3:00-4:30)Exploring Indian Vinegars & Its Usage In Indian Cooking & HistoryLive Demonstration Of Vinegar Making.Breakdown Of The Science Behind The TechniqueA Vinegar-Tasting Experience of 5 vinegars.Hands-On Shrub-Based Drink MakingHeat by Chef Gresham Fernandes (@greshamfernandes) (5:00-6:30)Discover the Secrets of Heat SourcesUncover the chemistry behind how heat worksLearn the wonders of wood-fired cookingPro techniques for smoking foodUsing heat to create different textures: dry jerky vs fish roast. Disclaimer: Programming is subject to change, please watch out for an official email a few days before the actual workshop.

location.address: 105, Kengal Hanumanthaiah Rd, opp. Corporation Bank, Raja Ram Mohanroy Extension, Shanti Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027, India

organizer.name: GOYA
organizer.description: Goya is a food & culture publication focussed on India & S Asia

name: Shamanic sound healing with Lifang Huang
description: Shamanic sound healing is a practice rooted in ancient spiritual traditions, where sound is used as a powerful tool for healing and transformation. Join Taiwanese Shamanic Sound healer Lifang Huang (@lifang_sound_healer_ ) for an evening of deep sound vibrations. Lifang Creates a healing sound bath using Tibetan singing bowls Nepalese shamanic drums her voice and other instruments.During a session, the participant typically lies down in a relaxed state while the practitioner plays the instruments in a rhythmic and intentional manner. The sounds are often rhythmic and repetitive, inducing a meditative or trance-like state that allows the participant to journey inward. This altered state of consciousness is where healing is said to occur, as the sounds help to align the mind, body, and spirit.

Whether you're a chef, foodie, flavour geek, or love to nerd out over the latest culinary trends and techniques, the Food Nerd Festival is your jam.With 4 workshops centred around the basic cooking elements, these immersives will leave you with an elevated culinary game.Salt by Chef Gautam & Bala (@gonzogarbanzo & @saltycuredpigs) (11-12:30)Guided Overview & History Of Preservation TechniquesExploring Techniques Of Pickling & Preserving In India & Around The WorldUnderstanding Curing Salts & The Science Behind ThemExpert Tips On Mastering Salt, Time, & FermentationLive Demonstration Of A Traditional Pickling TechniqueLive Demonstration Of A Meat Curing TechniqueRecipes For Pickling & Curing Bacon At HomeFat by Heena Punwani (@tiffintales, founder of Maska Bakery) (1:00-2:30)Cracking The Code Of Baking Theory: The Science Behind ItThe History Of Fats In CookingUnderstanding Different Fats In Indian BakingCookie Tasting Session Showcasing Different FatsOil Vs. Ghee: Flavor ShowdownLive Fat-Washing Cocktail DemoAcid by Payal Shah (@kobofermentery) (3:00-4:30)Exploring Indian Vinegars & Its Usage In Indian Cooking & HistoryLive Demonstration Of Vinegar Making.Breakdown Of The Science Behind The TechniqueA Vinegar-Tasting Experience of 5 vinegars.Hands-On Shrub-Based Drink MakingHeat by Chef Gresham Fernandes (@greshamfernandes) (5:00-6:30)Discover the Secrets of Heat SourcesUncover the chemistry behind how heat worksLearn the wonders of wood-fired cookingPro techniques for smoking foodUsing heat to create different textures: dry jerky vs fish roast. Disclaimer: Programming is subject to change, please watch out for an official email a few days before the actual workshop.

location.address: 105, Kengal Hanumanthaiah Rd, opp. Corporation Bank, Raja Ram Mohanroy Extension, Shanti Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027, India

organizer.name: GOYA
organizer.description: Goya is a food & culture publication focussed on India & S Asia

name: Roots of Resilience: Nurturing Mindfulness Through Gardening
description: Step into a calming space where nature and mindfulness come together in Roots of Resilience: Nurturing Mindfulness Through Gardening. This unique experience invites you to connect with the earth while cultivating resilience and well-being through the mindful practice of gardening. As you nurture plants and engage with the soil, you'll discover how the act of tending to nature can reduce stress, promote inner calm, and foster personal growth.This 90-minute experience is open to everyone, whether you’re a seasoned gardener or completely new to the practice. In a supportive and relaxing environment, you’ll learn how the simple, grounding process of gardening can help you reconnect with yourself and the world around you.Please wear comfortable, outdoor-appropriate clothing, as you’ll be engaging directly with the earth. All tools and materials will be provided. The session is gentle and can be adapted for all fitness levels, so you can participate at your own pace. If you have any health concerns or physical limitations, please inform the facilitator in advance, and adjustments will be made to ensure your comfort.While the experience is designed for all, please note that bookings are non-refundable and non-cancellable. Should you have any questions, don’t hesitate to reach out to us at info@zuva.life. We look forward to sharing this grounding journey with you, helping you grow both in the garden and within yourself.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.description: Zuva Life is redefining what it means to thrive across the life continuum. By rethinking purpose and reimagining living, we offer experiences that inspire people to rediscover their passions and build meaningful communities.

name: Exploring Tarot: What is Tarot and Pathfinding Workshop
description: A 90-minute session curated to help you understand what Tarot is, and how it helps and would also help you understand whether this is aligned with your goal of learning tarot. During the session we will only cover my teaching style and if that may be aligned with what you have in mind. We will not be going over the meanings of cards during this session. The session will primarily be based on understanding what Tarot is.

name: Screening: Annie Hall (1977) | Movie Under the Stars
description: Join us for an open-air screening of Annie Hall (1977), with a three-course dinner and popcorn.*Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the movieAnnie Hall (1977) is a romantic comedy directed by and starring Woody Allen, alongside Diane Keaton. The film follows the neurotic comedian Alvy Singer (Allen) as he reflects on his relationship with the quirky, free-spirited Annie Hall (Keaton). Through a series of flashbacks, Alvy recounts the ups and downs of their romance, exploring themes of love, identity, and personal growth. The film’s non-linear narrative, breaking of the fourth wall, and witty dialogue set it apart, making it a landmark in modern romantic comedies. Annie Hall won four Academy Awards, including Best Picture and Best Actress for Keaton.3-Course Dinner MenuCourse 1Bell Pepper, Broccoli and Zucchini QuicheCourse 2Spaghetti and Meatballs (Chicken / Vegetarian)Served with garlic breadCourse 3﻿Devils food cake with red wine & cherries______Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: The Kids Playdate - Diwali Edition
description: Courtyard's monthly playdate with The LooRoo Club is back!Join us at the yard to celebrate the magic of Diwali – The Festival of Lights!The morning will begin with a storytelling session of the interactive board book “Kahaani Puraani” by T4Tales. There will be Diyas and Diwali treats, nature lanterns and painting! Expect a burst of color, laughter, and play as we immerse your little ones in the joy and nostalgia of Diwali.Come be part of this vibrant celebration and let’s bring this cherished festival to life!Plus, the kids will take home a copy of the book as a special keepsake! For Kids aged 3- 6 years and their parentsTerms and ConditionsThe management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. Paid valet parking available at Rs. 200 per car.Ticket holders grant organizers perpetual rights to use any recorded video or still footage of their appearance on any channel, without further approval.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

All consumption of food & beverages will be borne individually based on your consumption. ✨enVie✨ will help you with a specially curated menu for exclusive options.Cheers and see you soon!Team ✨enVie✨

name: Enjoy a Bento box with Strangers
description: Ready for a night of bites and banter?Let Wednesday be your midweek pitstop to recharge 🏁🔋.Join us at Bento Bento 🎏, where strangers become friends!Feeling like it’s time to spice up your social life and your taste buds? 🥢🍣 Book your table and treat yourself to an epic Pan Asian feast—each bite is like a mini-vacation across Asia! @bentobento.bangalore is the perfect place to let loose and enjoy a cozy K-drama-inspired spot that’s got all the vibes you didn’t know you needed. ✨What happens when you mix mouthwatering food with great conversation? Magic. This isn’t just dinner—it’s your chance to embark on a wholesome culinary adventure and make new friends.So come hungry, come curious, and leave with a full belly and a few new buddies. Let’s turn strangers into friends—one sushi roll at a time!

name: A Lyrical Walk with Queer-love poems
description: Poetry is the queerest thing that may happen to a culture - with the power to capture the center and yet exist at the margins. With 'A Lyrical Walk with queer-love poems' we celebrate the most dazzling intersection of - queer love & poetry. No poetry exists without at least a touch of a dripping rainbow.Dillipoetry invites queer folx and allies to a two-hour-long healing nature walk in Cubbon Park to honour queer love, anger, and grief. The walk will bring into play - the most outrageous, delicious, resilient, & devastating poetry composed by a set of brilliant queer poets - as prompts and meditative tools to immerse in nature. About the host: Rachit is the founder and curator of Dillipoetry, a literary platform known for its experiential poetry workshops and forest healing walks. He is also the creative head at Youth Alliance, where he designs and facilitates transformational journeys of (un) learning, healing, and enquiry in the youth leadership development domain. His poetry and other writings have been published by 20+ literary platforms and anthologies including - Muse India, SIMS Library of Poetry, California, Livewire, The Honest Ulsterman, Northern Ireland among others. Rachit has performed at the BBC Contains Strong Language, the largest poetry festival in the UK, The French Institue India, Alliance française, etc. He also appeared & performed on BBC Radio 3’s popular show, The Verb.

location.address: XHJW+9QR, Cubbon Rd, Ambedkar Veedhi, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Dillipoetry
organizer.description: A literary platform attempting to de-pedestalize poetry to make it accessible, experiential & embodied

name: Friday Adda - Drinks & Conversations with Strangers
description: Kick off a fun Friday night the right way—with drinks in hand and a buzz of energy in the air! 🍹🎉Dive into exciting conversations with total strangers, share some laughs, swap wild stories, and maybe even a few secrets. 😉 Who knows? You might just meet your new best friend or future partner-in-crime! 🕵️‍♀️✨The vibe is all about having fun, making unforgettable connections, and soaking in the weekend energy. And we’ve got just the right drinks to set the tone! 🥂 Sip on desi-inspired cocktails—think spicy masala twists, tangy tamarind surprises, and sweet ‘n’ sour classics that will keep the conversations (and laughter) flowing all night long! 🍸🇮🇳With good drinks and even better company, this is one night you won’t forget! 🔥So, are you ready to say cheers to spontaneity and the thrill of new encounters? 🍻 Come raise a toast and kick off your weekend in true Friday Adda style! ✨

name: Sunday Breakfast with Strangers
description: Start your day right with a scrumptious breakfast! 🍳But it’s not just about the food—it’s about creating connections and making memories that last. Join us for fun conversations as you savor a delicious spread featuring options like a fluffy Omelette or Croissant Sandwich, Pancakes, Waffles, or French Toast drizzled with syrup, and a Pastry of the Day to satisfy your sweet tooth. 🥐🧇🍰Pair it all with a refreshing Fresh Fruit Juice and your choice of Coffee or Tea for that perfect morning boost. ☕🍵Don’t miss this chance to kick off your day with hearty bites and uplifting company. Mark your calendar and come join us for a morning full of delicious flavors and delightful chats. ✨

name: THE READING SOCIAL
description: Turn your breakfast in bed to breakfast at C+C, with one of our favourite weekend traditions : The Reading Social. A wholesome morning with coffee cups, books and the reading social community. If this sounds like a perfect way to spend your morning, join us for the reading social 📚☕🥙How do you like the idea of spending a Sunday morning, by yourself - reading/writing/journaling or indulging in any other silent activity you've been craving for? Reserve your spot now, you deserve to grab that morning coffee and just unwind!
